conclusion: The suitcase can be pushed or pulled; mass is 15 kg; pull force is 90 N; angle θ; gravitational acceleration is 10 m/s²; sin 37° = 0.6; resistance proportional to supporting force with ratio μ.
Image shows a suitcase on the ground with forces acting on it, including a pull force of 90 N at angle θ and gravitational force downward.
Total force applied by passenger is 90 N; gravitational force on suitcase is 150 N.
Minimum upward force is 90 N; horizontal resistance is 60 N.
Resistance is proportional to ground's supporting force, given by ratio μ.
Supporting force equals vertical component of pull force, 90 N * sin θ.
Since sin 37° = 0.6, supporting force is 54 N.
Resistance is 96 N, proportional to supporting force.
